questions.statement: CSS stands for __________
questions.explanation: CSS is a style sheet language which stands for Cascading Style Sheet.

questions.statement: In CSS, h1 can be called as _______
questions.explanation: HTML element h1 is used in CSS for styling then it is also called a selector. Attributes are the special words which control the element’s behaviour. To show the start and end of HTML element, tag is used.

questions.statement: In css, “color:red” can be called as _____________
questions.explanation: In CSS, color:red is the declaration for an element saying that the given element has to apply a red color. Color is one of CSS property.

questions.statement: Which of the following attributes is used to specify elements to bind style rules to?
questions.explanation: In CSS, styling elements can be done by id, class and tag attribute.

questions.statement: Which selector is used to specify a rule to bind a particular unique element?
questions.explanation: For binding a particular unique element, id selectors are used. While for group of elements, class selector can be used.

questions.statement: In CSS, “font-size” can be called as ________
questions.explanation: In CSS, font-size is a property-name which increases/decreases the font of text.

questions.statement: _________ selectors are used to specify a group of elements.
questions.explanation: Class selectors are used to specify a group of elements. Id selector specifies a particular unique element.

questions.statement: Which of the following tag is used to embed css in html page?
questions.explanation: <style> </style> tag is used to embed CSS in HTML page, while <script> </script> is used to embed JS in HTML. <!DOCTYPE html> is HTML5 declaration.

questions.statement: __________ has introduced text, list, box, margin, border, color, and background properties.
questions.explanation: CSS is a style sheet language which stands for Cascading Style Sheet. CSS has introduced text, list, box, margin, border, color, and background properties.

questions.statement: Is it the best way to include H1 heading only one time on the web page.
questions.explanation: It is good practice to include H1 heading only once and to use H2-H6 heading in other areas.

questions.statement: Which of the following element is used by the filter property to blur the images?
questions.explanation: Blurs an element, for use by the filter property. Accepts a distance measurement within which pixels are randomly scattered. A value of 0 leaves the image as is.

questions.statement: Which of the following function adjust the brightness of an element’s color, for use by the filter property?
questions.explanation: A value of 100% or decimal value of 1 leaves the image as is, while 0 produces black. Increasing the value from 1 or 100% brightens pixels from their original values.

questions.statement: Which of the following function adjusts the difference between light and dark values, for use by the filter property?
questions.explanation: A value of 100% or a decimal value of 1 leaves the image as is, while 0 results in black. Increasing the value past 1 or 100% produces more dramatically stratified areas of light and dark.

questions.statement: Which of the following function with filter property to create your own sophisticated effects on DOM elements?
Which of the following function converts an element’s color to a shade of gray, for use by the filter property?
questions.explanation: A decimal value between 0 and 1 or percentage up to 100% controls the extent of the gray effect.

questions.statement: Which of the following function flips an element’s colors, for use by the filter property?
questions.explanation: A decimal value between 0 and 1 or percentage up to 100% controls the extent of the color-negative effect, with 0.5 or 50% producing gray.

questions.statement: Which of the following function applies a saturation effect to an element’s color, making it appear more or less vivid, for use by the filter property?
questions.explanation: A decimal value of 1 or percentage of 100% keeps the image as is, while increasing the amount produces more dramatically stratified hues.

questions.statement: Which of the following function defines a linear gradient as a CSS image?
Which of the following function two dimensional transformation in matrix format?
Which of the following function apply a sepia tinge to an element’s color, typical of old photographs, for use by the filter property?
Which of the following value is supposed to be a slightly bolder weight that standard bold in font attribute?
Which of the following property allows contextual adjustment of inter-glyph spacing, i.e. the spaces between the characters in text?

Which of the following is not a appropriate value for font-variant property?

Which of the following Allows you to expand or condense the widths for a normal, condensed, or expanded font face?
Which of the following font-size-adjust is value used in calculating the size of the fallback fonts?
“font-style comes first than font-weight in font attribute”.State true or false.
questions.explanation:
Syntax
font: font-weight font-style font-variant font-size/line-height font-family .

questions.statement: Which of the following is the CSS Extension Prefixes for Webkit?
questions.explanation: Browser sometimes adds prefixes to non-standard CSS properties. CSS Extension prefix for Webkit is -webkit which is supported by almost all ios browsers. -o is used by opera where as -moz is used by firefox browser.

questions.statement: Which CSS property is equivalent for the attribute <center>?
questions.explanation: The attribute <center> in html aligns the text in center. In CSS, this is equivalent to align property which can align text to right, left or center as per the value. Margin property sets the margin for an element. Color property is used to set/assign colour to element. Font property is for increasing/decreasing the font of text.

questions.statement: Which CSS property is Equivalent for the align attribute?
questions.explanation: In the case of some elements such as , the CSS float property is more appropriate than text-align. text-align. Center attribute can only align text to center. Now-a-days it is not supported.

questions.statement: Which is the latest version of CSS available?
questions.explanation: There are three different kinds of versions of CSS i.e CSS1, CSS2 and CSS3. Out of them CSS3 is the latest version to be used.

questions.statement: Which CSS property is equivalent for the attribute <font>?
questions.explanation: Both font-style and font-family are for styling the text. They show text in different kinds of styles. Color is for setting/assigning colour to text or element. The font-size property in CSS is equivalent to attribute <font>. Both of them either increase/decrease the font of text.

questions.statement: Which of the following CSS property is used to give a line over the text?
questions.explanation: Text-decoration is a CSS property used to decorate the text. The text-decoration property takes many values such as overline, underline, line-through, none, inherit, etc. Overline gives a line over the text. Underline value is used to add line under the text. None value defines a normal text. When one wants to give a line through the text, line-through value for text-property can be used.

questions.statement: The first CSS specification to become an official W3C Recommendation is ___________
questions.explanation: The first CSS specification to become an official W3C Recommendation is CSS level 1, published on December 17, 1996. Håkon Wium Lie and Bert Bos are credited as the original developers.

questions.statement: _________ first became a Candidate Recommendation on February 25, 2004, but it was reverted to a Working Draft on June 13, 2005 for further review.
questions.explanation: CSS level 2 revision 1, often referred to as “CSS 2.1”, fixes errors in CSS 2, removes poorly supported or not fully interoperable features and adds already implemented browser extensions to the specification. To comply with the W3C Process for standardizing technical specifications, CSS 2.1 went back and forth between Working Draft status and Candidate Recommendation status for many years. CSS 2.1 first became a Candidate Recommendation on February 25, 2004, but it was reverted to a Working Draft on June 13, 2005 for further review.

questions.statement: There is no single, integrated ____________________ because it is split into separate modules.
questions.explanation: Here is no single, integrated CSS4 specification,[42] because it is split into separate modules. However, there are “level 4” modules.

questions.statement: Unlike CSS 2, which is a large single specification defining various features?
questions.explanation: Unlike CSS 2, which is a large single specification defining various features, CSS 3 is divided into several separate documents called “modules”. Each module adds new capabilities or extends features defined in CSS 2, preserving backward compatibility.

questions.statement: ___________ describes CSS properties to manipulate the position of “ruby”, which are small annotations on top of or next to words, especially common in Chinese and Japanese.
questions.explanation: Align is used to align the content either left, right or center. Ruby describes CSS properties to manipulate the position of “ruby”, which are small annotations on top of or next to words, especially common in Chinese and Japanese. They are often used to give the pronunciation or meaning of difficult ideograms. Text-align is for aligning the text either left, right or in center.

questions.statement: ___________ has a grammar but unlike traditional (X)HTML it is not defined with a document type definition.
questions.explanation: CSS 2.1 has a grammar (www.w3.org/TR/CSS21/grammar.html) but unlike traditional (X)HTML it is not defined with a document type definition. Instead the CSS specification is a combination of prose and a grammar that could be used to build a simple parser.

questions.statement:
What will be the output of following code snippet?

h1 {color: red text-decoration: underline; font-style: italic;}
questions.explanation:
In this case, we should see the browser continue to parse the value of color as “red textdecoration:
underline” before it sees a closing semicolon. The font-style property that follows would then be used. Because the color property has an illegal value, it should be
ignored.

options.text: color: red, text-decoration: underline and font-style: italic all works
text-decoration: underline and font-style: italic works

questions.statement:
What will be the output of below mentioned code snippet?

 h1 {color: "green";}
questions.explanation: Output of above code snippet won’t happen as the declaration syntax is wrong. The correct declaration is : h1 { color: green; } which will yeild an output. In CSS, we don’t write value in double quotes.

questions.statement: Which of the following is the correct way to applying style to a document?
questions.explanation: We can style the document using CSS in three different ways i.e embed, inline and external. In any way as mentioned, we can apply CSS.  An inline CSS means applying styles rules directly to the element. In embed, we declare or write all the needed style in <style></style> tag in the head element of the document. Expect these two ways we can also use another way in which we can create an external style sheet and provide its link to the document.

options.text: Use an external style sheet, either by importing it or by linking to it
Directly embed a document-wide style in the head element of the document
Set an inline style rule using the style attribute directly on an element

questions.statement:
With, which tag you write the style rules directly within the document found,
within the head of the document.
questions.explanation: In <style></style> tag we write the style rules directly within the document in the head section of the document. <script></script> tag is used to add javascript in the document.

questions.statement: What does screen media type is used for?
questions.explanation: In CSS, media types are used for the compatibility of devices. There are four types of nedia types i.e all, print, screen and speech. Out of which screen media type is used for computer screens, tablets, smart-phones, etc.

questions.statement: For Inline Style, we don’t need to reapply style information throughout the document and outside documents.
questions.explanation: In inline style, properties are confined with a particular element to which it is applied. It won’t be applied to other element of the same type. We need to reapply style information throughout the document whenever it is necessary.

questions.statement: Inline style has the lowest priority
questions.explanation: Among inline, embed and external style ways, inline has the highest priority and it overrides the other.

questions.statement: For External Style Sheets in some cases when @import is used, the browser may cause a rendering “flash” under slow loading conditions.
questions.explanation: External Style Sheets in some cases when @import is used the browser may cause a rendering “flash” under slow loading conditions.

questions.statement: Which of the following tag is used to linked information should be placed inside?
questions.explanation: Linked information regarding CSS like external CSS document information is always placed in <head> tag. <body> tag contains the body of the document.

questions.statement: Which of the following tag can be used to embed a Document-wide styles in a document’s head element?
questions.explanation: Document-wide styles can be embedded in a document’s head element using the <style> tag. <script> </script> tag is used for Javascript.

questions.statement: The ________________ directive allows style sheets to be grouped and joined together, though some might wonder what the value of this function is given what linked styles provide.
questions.explanation: Within embedded <style> blocks, properties can be imported from an external file and expanded in place, similar to a macro. Importing can be used to include multiple style sheets. An imported style is defined within a <style> tag using @import followed optionally by a type value and a URL for the style sheet. <style> & <script> tag conatins CSS and Javascript content respectively. The metadata content is present in <head> tag.

questions.statement: Which of the following measurement defines a measurement relative to a font’s x-height?
questions.explanation: Defines a measurement relative to the height of a font in em spaces. Because an em unit is equivalent to the size of a given font, if you assign a font to 12pt, each em unit would be 12pt, thus 2em would be 24pt.

questions.statement: Which of the following measurement defines measurement as a percentage?
questions.explanation: Defines a measurement as a percentage. Percentages are denoted by a number followed by the % symbol and are always relative to another value such as length. Quite often they are used to specify some value relative to an inherited value from a parent element.

questions.statement: Which of the following property sets the font size of text?
questions.explanation:
Syntax:
font-size: length | percentage | larger | smaller | xx-small | x-small | 
small | medium | large | x-large | xx-larger | inherit

questions.statement: Which of the following property sets a variation of the specified or default font family?
questions.explanation:
Syntax:
font-variant: normal | small-caps | inherit
The small-caps value sets text in smaller-size all capitals. The normal value would be used to override any inherited font-variant value. Font-weight is for increasing/decreasing weight of font. It takes values like normal, bold, lighter, and bolder.

questions.statement: Which of the following property defines labels for a list of items?
questions.explanation:
Syntax:
list-style-type: disc | circle | square | decimal | decimal-leading-zero
list-style-image add graphical image to a list item. List-style sets all the properties for a list.

questions.statement: Which of the following property assigns a graphic image to a list item?
questions.explanation:
list-style-type defines labels for a list of item. List-style property set all the properties for a list. List-style-image assign image to a list item.
Syntax:
list-style-image: url(url of image) | none

questions.statement: Which of the following property sets the amount of spacing between letters?
questions.explanation:
letter-spacing property sets the amount of spacing between letters.
Syntax:
letter-spacing: length | normal | inherit
Length values can be set in various units (negative values are permitted) or to the default value normal.

questions.statement: Which of the following CSS3 Color Feature can be used as a macro for whatever the current color is?
questions.explanation: This is useful if you want to dynamically change one color and have other related colors change.

questions.statement: Which of the following CSS3 Color Feature like RGB color but adds an alpha channel value to specify the opacity of the color?
questions.explanation: An RGBa is specified via a function style rgba(r,g,b,a) value, where colors r, g, and b are specified as a decimal value from 0 to 255 or a percentage from 0 to 100%, and the alpha channel value for defining opacity is a number between 0 (fully transparent) and 1 (fully opaque). Values outside this range will be rounded up or down to fit the closest value.

questions.statement: Which of the following Color Format is a CSS’s six-digit hexadecimal format is the same as color defined in (X)HTML?
questions.explanation: The format specifies color as #rrggbb, where rr is the amount of red, gg the amount of green, and bb the amount of blue, all specified in a hexadecimal value ranging from 00 to FF.

questions.statement: Which of the following Color Format is a CSS2 introduced named color keywords which allows Web page colors to be matched to an operating system’s color use?
Which of the following Color Format are a 17 defined colors under CSS 2.1?
questions.explanation:
maroon (#800000) red (#ff0000)
orange (#ffA500) yellow (#ffff00)
olive (#808000) purple (#800080)
fuchsia (#ff00ff ) white (#ffffff)
lime (#00ff00) green (#008000)
navy (#000080) blue (#0000ff)
aqua (#00ffff) teal (#008080)
black (#000000) silver (#c0c0c0)
gray (#808080)
Other color keywords may be commonly used but are ad hoc in their definition.

questions.statement: Which of the following Color Format is a CSS colors can also be defined using the keyword rgb, followed by three numbers between 0 and 255, contained in parentheses and separated by commas, with no spaces between them?
questions.explanation: RGB color values can also be defined using percentages. The format is the same, except that the numbers are replaced by percentage values between 0% and 100%.

questions.explanation: The border-width property sets the width of an element’s four borders. This property can have from one to four values.

questions.statement: Identify the CSS property defining bottom-left corner shape of the border?
questions.explanation: CSS3 border-radius property allows you can give any element “rounded corners”.

questions.statement: Select the  CSS property that sets the width of an element’s bottom border?
questions.explanation: The border-bottom-width CSS property sets the width of the bottom border of a box.

questions.statement: Which of the following CSS property border-color property sets the color of an element’s four borders?
questions.explanation: The border-color property sets the color of an element’s four borders. This property can have from one to four values.

questions.statement: Choose the CSS property that can be used for collapsing the borders between table cells?
questions.explanation: The border-collapse property sets whether the table borders are collapsed into a single border or detached as in standard HTML.

questions.statement: Which CSS property can be used to set the image as border instead of the border style?
questions.explanation: The border-image-source property specifies the path to the image to be used as a border (instead of the normal border around an element).

questions.statement: In how many way border-image-width CSS property can be defined?
questions.explanation: The border-image-width CSS property defines the offset to use for dividing the border image in nine parts, the top-left corner, central top edge, top-right-corner, central right edge, bottom-right corner, central bottom edge, bottom-left corner, and central right edge.

questions.statement: Which of the following is not an appropriate value for border-collapse?
questions.explanation: Except option a, all other values can be set to border collapse CSS property.

questions.statement: Which of the following specifies the distance between the borders of adjacent cells?
questions.explanation: The border-spacing property sets the distance between the borders of adjacent cells (only for the “separated borders” model).

questions.statement: Which of the following property defines the border-width, border-style and border-color of an element’s top border in a single declaration?
questions.explanation: The border-top shorthand property sets all the top border properties in one declaration.

questions.statement: Which of the following property specifies the look and design of an outline?

questions.statement: Which of the following values specifies a 3D grooved outline?
questions.explanation: groove specifies a 3D grooved border. The effect depends on the border-color value.

questions.statement: ____________ types are mutually exclusive in the sense that a user agent can only support one media type when rendering a document.
questions.explanation: Media types are mutually exclusive in the sense that a user agent can only support one media type when rendering a document. However, user agents may use different media types on different canvases. For example, a document may (simultaneously) be shown in ‘screen’ mode on one canvas and ‘print’ mode on another canvas.

questions.statement: If an @media/@import rule contains a malformed media type (not an identifier) then the statement is valid. State true or false.
questions.explanation: @media and @import rules with unknown media types (that are nonetheless valid identifiers) are treated as if the unknown media types are not present. If an @media/@import rule contains a malformed media type (not an identifier) then the statement is invalid.

questions.statement: Media type names are case-insensitive. State true or false.

Which of the following elements are block and inline elements, respectively, that have no particular rendering?
questions.explanation: The div element and span element are block and inline elements, respectively, that have no particular rendering. You might call them generic tags. Because these tags don’t have any predefined meaning or rendering, they are very useful for arbitrary style duties.

questions.statement: The _____________ property specifies the background color of an element.
The ___________ property specifies if/how an element is displayed.
The _____________ property allows us to include the padding and border in an element’s total width and height.
____________ property sets the coordinates of the clipping shape that exposes or hides the content of absolutely positioned elements
_____________ property defines the space between cells in a table.
____________ property defines whether table cell borders are connected or separate.
questions.explanation: border-collapse roperty defines whether table cell borders are connected or separate.

questions.statement: ________________ property sets the background image to scroll or not to scroll with its associated element’s content
____________ property associates a background image with an element.
______________ property defines whether table cell borders are connected or separate.
Which of the following CSS property sets the opacity level for an element?
questions.explanation: The opacity property defines the transparency-level, where 1 is opaque, 0.5 is translucent, and 0 is completely transparent.

questions.statement: Which of the following property specifies the order of a flexible item relative to the rest of the flexible items inside the same container?
questions.explanation: The CSS order property specifies the order used to lay out flex items in their flex container. Elements are laid out in the ascending order of the order value.

questions.statement: Which of the following is an appropriate value for overflow element?
questions.explanation: Overflow of a div or a container can have the following values: visible|hidden|scroll|auto|initial|inherit.

questions.statement: Identify the CSS property that specifies the length of the space used for the tab character.
questions.explanation: The tab-size CSS property is used to customize the width of a tab.

questions.statement: Which of the following property specifies the stack order of an element?
questions.explanation: The correct option is z-index. It can only be applied on positioned values.

questions.statement: Which of the following property allows long words to be able to be broken and wrap onto the next line?
questions.explanation: This property helps you break the words and wrap onto the next line to prevent overflow of div.

questions.statement: Which of the following CSS property can be used to provide the flex-direction and flex-wrap properties?
questions.explanation: It is a shorthand for both flex-direction and flex-wrap.

questions.statement: Which of the following specifies how much the item will grow relative to the rest of the flexible items inside the same container?
Which of the following property aligns the flexible container’s items when the items do not use all available space on the main-axis?
questions.explanation: The CSS justify-content property defines how the browser distributes space between and around flex items along the main-axis of their container.

questions.statement: Choose the CSS property which specifies the placement of a table caption.
questions.explanation: The caption-side CSS property positions the content of a table’s caption on the specified side.

questions.statement: If a particular rule should never be overridden by another rule, the ____________ indication should be used.
questions.explanation: If a particular rule should never be overridden by another rule, the !important indication should be used. For a rule never to be ignored, insert the indication !important just before the semicolon of the rule.

questions.statement: Which of the following option a rule consists of?
Which of the following option a declaration consist of?
questions.explanation:
A declaration has two parts separated by a colon:
Property – that part before the colon
Value – that part after the colon.

questions.statement: The ______________ is the link between the HTML document and the style. It specifies what elements are affected by the declaration.
questions.explanation: The selector is the link between the HTML document and the style. It specifies what elements are affected by the declaration. The declaration is that part of the rule that sets forth what the effect will be.

questions.statement: How a style sheet can be glued to the HTML document?

options.text: Import a style sheet using the CSS @import notation.
Apply the basic, document-wide style sheet for the document by using the style element
Link an external style sheet to the document using the link elemen

questions.statement: As a general rule, properties in CSS inherit from ___________ elements
CSS3 ___________ let you display smooth transitions between two or more specified colors
questions.explanation: Earlier, you had to use images for these effects. However, by using CSS3 gradients you can reduce download time and bandwidth usage. In addition, elements with gradients look better when zoomed, because the gradient is generated by the browser.

questions.statement: The ___________________ property specifies whether or not an element should be resizable by the user.

The __________ specifies style sheets for a source document according to the conventions of the document language. For instance, in HTML, style sheets may be included in the document or linked externally.
questions.explanation: Author. The author specifies style sheets for a source document according to the conventions of the document language. For instance, in HTML, style sheets may be included in the document or linked externally.

questions.statement: The __________ may be able to specify style information for a particular document. For example, the user may specify a file that contains a style sheet or the user agent may provide an interface that generates a user style sheet.
questions.explanation: User: The user may be able to specify style information for a particular document. For example, the user may specify a file that contains a style sheet or the user agent may provide an interface that generates a user style sheet (or behaves as if it did) .

questions.statement: Each property may also have a cascaded value of ___________ which means that, for a given element, the property takes the same specified value as the property for the element’s parent.
questions.explanation: Each property may also have a cascaded value of ‘inherit’, which means that, for a given element, the property takes the same specified value as the property for the element’s parent. The ‘inherit’ value can be used to enforce inheritance of values, and it can also be used on properties that are not normally inherited.

questions.statement: Which of the following strings are defined by in css?
questions.explanation: In CSS, strings are defined with either single quotes (‘example’) or double quotes (“example”). Quotes may be found within the opposite quote (“I say this is an ‘example’!”).

options.text: both single quotes and double quotes

questions.statement: Which of the following defined as alphanumeric names that correspond to some current counter value in a document?
questions.explanation: Counters demonstrate the possibility of variable-like values in CSS. They are defined as alphanumeric names that correspond to some current counter value in a document.

questions.statement: Which of the following is the Color Format that is a CSS’s six-digit hexadecimal format as color defined in (X)HTML?
questions.explanation: CSS’s six-digit hexadecimal format is the same as color defined in (X)HTML. The format specifies color as #rrggbb, where rr is the amount of red, gg the amount of green, and bb the amount of blue, all specified in a hexadecimal value ranging from 00 to FF.

questions.statement: Which of the following is the Color Format that is the CSS3 HSL value with a fourth value to set the alpha channel value for the color to define the opacity of the element?
questions.explanation: An HSLa is specified via a function style hsla(hue,saturation, lightness, alpha), where hue, saturation, and lightness are the same as standard hsl() values, and the alpha channel value for defining opacity is a number between 0 (fully transparent) and 1 (fully opaque).

questions.statement: Which of the following is the Color Format that is a defined using the keyword rgb, followed by three numbers between 0 and 255, contained in parentheses and separated by commas, with no spaces between them.
questions.explanation: RGB color values can also be defined using percentages. The format is the same, except that the numbers are replaced by

questions.statement: Which of the following property determines whether or not an element is visible?
questions.explanation: This property is not the same as display: none as it simply makes the item invisible; it does not completely remove it from the display canvas.

questions.statement: Which of the following property controls how spaces, tabs, and newline characters are handled in an element?
questions.explanation: The values of pre-wrap and pre-line are not supported in older browsers.

questions.statement: Which of the following property defines the minimum number of lines in a paragraph to be left at the top of a page?
questions.explanation: This property is really only meaningful in a paged environment, such as print output.

questions.statement: Which of the following property sets the spacing between words?

questions.explanation: Defines a measurement relative to the height of a font in em spaces. Because an em unit is equivalent to the size of a given font, if you assign a font to 12pt, each em unit would be 12pt, thus 2em would be 24pt.

questions.statement: Which of the following measurement defines a measurement in points?
questions.explanation: Defines a measurement in points. A point is defined as 1/72nd of an inch. A point does not equate to a pixel unless there are 72 pixels per inch onscreen.

questions.statement: Which of the following CSS Property controls how an element is positioned?
questions.explanation: Controls how an element is positioned. When set to absolute or fixed, the element is removed completely from the normal flow of the document. When set to relative, the element is moved relative to its position in the normal flow, but a space is left where it would normally have been. The default value, static, means the element remains in the normal flow and is not positioned.

questions.statement: Which of the following Microsoft-introduced property defines the position of underlining set by the text-decoration property?
Which of the following are different origins of style sheets?
questions.explanation:
Author: The author specifies style sheets for a source document according to the conventions of the document language. For instance, in HTML, style sheets may be included in the document or linked externally.
User: The user may be able to specify style information for a particular document. For example, the user may specify a file that contains a style sheet or the user agent may provide an interface that generates a user style sheet (or behaves as if it did).
User agent: Conforming user agents must apply a default style sheet. A user agent’s default style sheet should present the elements of the document language in ways that satisfy general presentation expectations for the document language

questions.statement: Which of the following Cascading order has the highest precedence?
Which of the following property is used to define how nested items are rendered in a 3-D space?
questions.explanation: transform-style is used to define how nested items are rendered in a 3-D space, the choice being either flattened or with their dimensions preserved. This property affects the children of the element and not the element itself. Also, the property does not cascade, so it is necessary to apply it at all levels.

questions.statement: Which of the following rule allows users to import style rules from other style sheets?
questions.explanation: The @import rule allows users to import style rules from other style sheets. If an @import rule refers to a valid stylesheet, user agents must treat the contents of the stylesheet as if they were written in place of the @import rule.

questions.statement: Which of the following selector is used to selects siblings?
questions.explanation:
p ~ strong {font-style: italic;}
/* sets the font style to italic on all strong tags that have a p tag as a preceding sibling */

questions.statement: Which of the following selector is used to selects the elements that are the default among a set of similar elements?
questions.explanation:
:default {background-color: red;}
/* sets the background color of a default button like a submit to red */

questions.statement: Which of the following selector is used to selects the element that is the first child of its parent that is of its type?
questions.explanation:
strong:first-of-type {font-size: bigger;}
/* sets the font size bigger on the first strong tag of its parent */

questions.statement: Which of the following selector is used to selects the element that is the nth child of its parent?
questions.explanation:
div:nth-child(2) {background-color: red;}
/* sets the background color to red if the div is its parent’s second child */

questions.statement: Which of the following selector is used to selects the element that is the root of the document?
questions.explanation:
:root {background-color: blue;}
/* sets the background color to blue for the root element */

questions.statement: Which of the following selector is used to select elements that are read-only. When applied to form elements, this would select fields with the readonly attribute set?
questions.explanation:

/* put all read only fields in gray */

Which property is used to add space inside the text field?
questions.explanation:
Padding property is used to add space inside the text field, when we have many inputs after each other we can also add some margin to add more space outside,
 input[type=text] {padding:13px 30px; margin: 8px 0;}

questions.statement: Which one can animate the width of search input when get focus?
questions.explanation:
For animating the width of search input when it gets focus we used CSS transition property,
 input[type=text] {-webkit-transition: width 09s ease-in-out; transition: width 0.9s ease-in-out; } input[type=text]:focus {width:100%;}

questions.statement: Which of the following will insert generated content in the counter?
questions.explanation: content inserts generated content, counter-reset creates or resets a counter, counter-increment increments the value of the counter, counter() function adds the value of a counter to an element.

questions.statement: Which of the following is not the pseudo class for CSS Basic UI Level3?
questions.explanation: CSS Basic UI Level 3 has many pseudo-classes like :widget, :invalid, :valid, :in-range, :required, :read-write, :read-only, :optional, :out-of-range. CSS Selector Level 3 has the classes :disabled, :enabled, :indeterminate, :checked.

questions.statement: Which is not a Mozilla CSS Extension?
questions.explanation: Mozilla CSS Extensions include :-moz-placeholder, :-moz-ui-invalid, :moz-ui-valid, :moz-submit-invalid. ::-webkit-input-placeholder is Webkit CSS Extension, :-ms-input-placeholder is Microsoft CSS Extension.

questions.statement: Which of the following is an extension to the common JavaScript framework?
questions.explanation: Formalize is an extension to common JavaScript frameworks like JQuery, Dojo, YUI etc., it helps to normalize and customize the forms. Uni-form standardizes form markup, styling it with CSS, it also offers a few additional features when used with jQuery.

questions.statement: Which of the following will provide date pickers?
questions.explanation: jQuery UI offers some very interesting and advanced as well as customizable widgets like date pickers with special attention given to accessibility. Niceforms is a standalone JavaScript method that provides complete customization of web forms.

questions.statement: Which of the following helps to deal with HTML5 support?
questions.explanation: WebShim is a big tool that can help with browser HTML5 support, web form part can be very helpful. If you want to normalize forms Twitter Bootstrap can greatly help.

questions.statement: Which is not a WebKit value?
questions.explanation: WebKit includes various values like checkbox, button, button-level, menulist, scrollbarbutton-up, listitem, scrollbarbutton-left, caret, textfield, textarea, searchfield, searchfield-decoration, slider-vertical, slider-horizontal, scrollbargripper-horizontal etc.

questions.statement: Which is not a Mozilla value?
questions.explanation: Mozilla includes many values like menulist, radio, scrollbar, dialog, listbox, scrollbarbutton-down, scrollbar, resizer, checkbox, scrollbarbutton-up, separator, toolbar, toolbox, statusbar, separator, toolbarbutton, window, treetwisty, treeview etc.

questions.statement: Which is not the property of CSS box model?
questions.explanation: CSS box model include height, width, padding, margin and border. All text-fields have complete support for every property related to CSS box model. Browser relies on system default styles when displaying these widgets.

questions.statement: Which of the following is not the value for an unordered list?
questions.explanation:
For unordered list, we can use none, disc, square, circle. For ordered list, we can use decimals, decimal-leading-zero, lower-alpha, upper-roman, lower-roman.
 ol {list-style-type: lower roman;}

questions.statement: Which of the following value sits to the left of the block of text?
questions.explanation: List are indented into the page by default and list-style-position property indicates whether the marker should appear on inside or outside box containing main points. This property can take two values outside and inside. The marker sits to the left of the block of text, this is the default behavior if this property is not used.

questions.statement: Which is not a box-level element?
questions.explanation:
CSS treats each HTML element as if it is in its own box. This box will either be block-level Box or inline box. Block-level elements start on a new line e.g.

,

    ,
  • and

    . Inline elements follow in between surrounding text like , , .

questions.statement: In which every block-level element appears on a new line?
questions.explanation: Every block-level element appears on a new line, which causes each item to appear lower down the page than the previous one. Even if we specify the width of the boxes and there is space for two elements to sit side by side, they will not appear next to each other.

questions.statement: Which of the following will take the element out of normal flow?
questions.explanation: Floating an element allows us to take that element out of normal flow and position it too far left or right of a containing box. The floated element becomes block-level element around which other content can flow.

questions.statement: Which value clear property can’t take?
questions.explanation: The clear property allows us to say that no element within the same containing element should touch left or right hand sides of a box. It can take the values left, right, both or none. When set to none elements can touch either side.

questions.statement: Which of the property is not used for positioning columns next to each other?
questions.explanation: Many web pages used multiple columns in their design. The three CSS properties are used to position columns next to each other. Width, margin, and float. Width sets the width of the column, float positions columns next to each other, margin creates a gap between columns.

questions.statement: Which of the following is not the value for background-repeat property?
questions.explanation: Background-repeat property can have four values i.e. repeat, repeat-x, repeat-y and no -repeat. The background image is repeated both horizontally and vertically by setting the value repeat, repeat-x repeats the image horizontally only.

questions.statement: Which of the following will move the image up and down?
questions.explanation: The background image moves up and down as the user scrolls up and down the page. The fixed value helps background image stays in the same position on the page.

questions.statement: Which should be used to overlay text on image with high contrast?
questions.explanation: To overlay text on an image with high contrast, we can place a semi-transparent background color or “screen” behind the text to improve legibility. The majority of photographs have quite high contrast, that means they are not ideal for use as background image.

questions.statement: ID selector name is preceded by __________
questions.explanation:
In CSS class selector name is preceded by a full stop (‘.’) and ID selector name is preceded by hash character (‘#’).
#intro {background-color: red; padding: 30px; }, .top {color: white; font-weight: bold; }

questions.statement: Which of the following will represent browsers in their normal states?
questions.explanation: There are five major categories for image replacement i.e. CSS ON/Images ON, CSS ON/Images OFF, CSS OFF/Images ON, CSS OFF/Images ON, CSS OFF/Images OFF, Extra Unnecessary Markup. CSS ON/Images ON represents browsers in their normal states and all the techniques should pass their test.

questions.statement: Which of the following represents browsing with no stylesheets applied?
questions.explanation: CSS OFF/Images ON represents browsing with no stylesheets being applied. Most of the techniques default to regular web text here which is not exactly a fail, but since images may still be turned on.

questions.statement: Which of the following technique is also known as Fahrner Image Replacement?
questions.explanation: CSS ON/Images On technique is also known as FIR or “Fahrner Image Replacement”. The premise here is to use a span to wrap the text inside the header and use that span to hide the text. It works but we have to use display:none.

questions.statement: Using negative text-indent is also known as __________
questions.explanation: Using negative text-indent is also known as the Phark method. This is the most common technique that most web developers have used. The main idea is to move the text far outside the browser window by setting a large negative text-indent.

questions.statement: Using margin is also known as________
questions.explanation: Using margin is also used as Radu Darvas technique. This technique also forces the text outside of the browser window but uses margins to do so. The main idea is to apply very large negative left margin and give our header a correspondingly large width.

questions.statement: Using padding is also known as ________
questions.explanation: Using padding is known as Langridge method. We push the text outside of our header using padding-top property. The property is to be set to a value that is equal to the height of the logo. But this alone is not sufficient, we have to use overflow: hidden to hide the text.

questions.statement: Using Small font-size is also known as ____________
questions.explanation: Using small font-size is known as Lindsay method. Another way to hide text is by making it very small and set its color to the background of the image. This works without affecting accessibility but we can also face SEO penalties because of tiny font size and camouflaged color.

questions.statement: Using Overflow is known as ______
questions.explanation: In this method, overflow property is used to hide the element completely. Using this technique requires to wrap the text in a <span> element just like the other methods. The text is hidden by overflow: hidden property.

questions.statement: Using Absolute Positioning is known as _________
questions.explanation: This method also requires an additional <span> element to work. But the <span> element is not wrapped around the text but used to position our image.

questions.statement: Using a bogus image is also called as _______
questions.explanation: This method also requires a bogus image in addition to a usual <span> element to work properly. The image is a 1×1 pixel transparent GIF. The main purpose is to show users the alt text if images are turned off.

questions.statement: Using actual image with inline image method is also known as __________
questions.explanation: In this method, we use the actual image for image replacement. The image has alt text that will be shown when images are turned off. This technique does not seem to be good for SEO. Images will still be visible with CSS turned off and images kept on.

questions.statement: Using Pseudo element is known as _____________
questions.explanation:
This technique used the pseudo element to push the text aside.

Site

. The pseudo element pushes text aside. The text then overflows and is hidden by using overflow: hidden property.

questions.statement: What is the default value of visibility?
questions.explanation: The default value of visibility is visible, the element is visible. When set to hidden, the element is invisible but it still takes up space, initial sets the property to its default value. Inherit inherits this property from its parent element.

questions.statement: Which of the following is only for table elements?
questions.explanation: Collapse is only for table elements. Collapse removes row or column. But it does not affect table layout. The space taken up by row or column will be available for other content. If the collapse is used with other elements, it renders as “hidden”.

questions.statement: Clip property is not supported in ____________
questions.explanation:
There is one more way of hiding elements by clipping them. Clip-path property is not fully supported in IE or Edge yet. If using external SVG files for clip-path, support is even more limited.
 .hide {clip-path: polygon(0px 0px,0px 0px,0px 0px,0px 0px);}

questions.statement: @page is not supported in ________
questions.explanation: @page is not supported in Firefox, but is supported in Chrome 2.0+, IE 8.0+, Opera 6.0+ and safari 5.0+. @page:first is supported only in IE8+ and Opera 9.2+.

questions.statement: Which of the following does not break long URLs into a shorter one?
questions.explanation: word-wrap breaks long URLs when they reach a certain limit. This property is basically supported in a wide range of browsers even in IE 6, it works in chrome when printing. Firefox automatically breaks long URLs, Internet Explorer has no capability for breaking long URLs into the shorter one.

questions.statement: Orphans and widows properties are supported by _________
questions.explanation: Orphan property sets the number of lines for the bottom of the page. The orphans and widows properties are supported in IE 8+ and Opera 9.2+, but not in Firefox, Chrome or Safari.

questions.statement: Which of the following will take care of breaks behind an element?
questions.explanation: There are three CSS attributes page-break before, page-break-after and page-break-inside that allow us to decide exactly where a print page will be broken. Among other things, this will prevent images from being broken into two pieces.

questions.statement: What prohibits the break?
questions.explanation: Auto is print element’s standard, always places a break every time, avoid prohibits the break, left and right are for continuation pages that are formatted left or right accordingly.

questions.statement: Which of the following media type is used for computer screens?
questions.explanation: The screen media type is used for computer screens, smart-phones, tablets etc. The print media type is used for printers, speech is used for screenreaders that  “reads” the page loud, all is used for all media type devices.

questions.statement: Which value specifies the number of colors the device can display?
questions.explanation: The number of colors the device can display is specified by color-index, color-gamut specifies the approximate range of colors that are supported by a user agent and output device. The number of bits per color component for the output device is specified by color value.

questions.statement: Which value will define the viewport width?
questions.explanation: Width specifies the width of the viewport, update specify how quickly can output device modify the appearance of the content, the scan is set for scanning process of the output device, the resolution of output device using dpi or dpcm is by resolution.

questions.statement: Which of the following will specify minimum width of display area?
questions.explanation: The minimum width of a display area such as browser window is specified by min-width, min-resolution specify the minimum resolution of the device, using dpi or dpcm, monochrome specify the number of bits per “color” on a monochrome device.

questions.statement: Which of the following specify the approximate range of colors?
questions.explanation: The approximate range of colors that are supported by user agent and output device is specified by color-gamut, the number of colors the device can display is specified by color-index, the maximum number of bits per color component for the output device is specified by max-color.

questions.statement: Which of the following will select all elements within the class?
questions.explanation:
.class selects all elements within the given class, #id selects the element within the given id, element>element selects all

elements where parent is

element, element selects all

elements.

questions.statement:
Which of the following selects all
elements and all

elements?
questions.explanation:
element,element selects all
elements and all

elements, element element selects all

elements inside

elements, element>element selects all

elements where parent is a

element, element+element selects all

elements that are placed immediately after

element.

questions.statement: Which of the following selects all elements with a target attribute?
questions.explanation: attribute selects all elements with a target attribute, attribute=value selects all elements for the given target, attribute~=value selects all elements with a title attribute containing the given title, attribute=value selects all elements with a lang attribute value starting with the given lang.

questions.statement: Which of the following selects every <a> element whose href attribute value contains the given substring?
questions.explanation: attribute*=value selects every <a> element whose href attribute value contains the given substring, attribute$=value selects every <a> element whose href attribute value ends with the given href, attribute^=value selects every <a> element element whose href attribute value begins with “https”.

questions.statement:
Which of the following selects every

element that has no children?
questions.explanation:
:empty selects every

element that has no children including text nodes, :checked selects every checked element, :disabled selects every disabled element, :enabled selects every enabled element.

questions.statement: Which of the following selects input element which has focus?
questions.explanation: :focus selects input element which has focus, :hover selects links on mouse hover, :in-range selects input elements with a value within a specified range, :invalid selects all input elements with an invalid value.

questions.statement: Which selects all unvisited links?
questions.explanation:
:link selects all unvisited links, :not(selector) selects every element that is the second child of its parent, :last-child selects every

element that is the last child of its parent.

questions.statement:
Which of the following will select every

element that is the only child of its parent?
questions.explanation:
:only-child selects every

element that is the only child of its parent, :only-of-type selects every

element that is the only child of its parent, :optional selects input elements with no “required” attribute.

questions.statement: Which selects document’s root element?
questions.explanation: :root selects the document’s root element, ::selection selects the portion of an element that is selected by a user, :required selects input elements with “required” attribute specified, :out-of-range selects input elements with a value outside a specified range.

questions.statement: Which selects all visited links?
questions.explanation: :visited selects all visited links, :valid selects all input elements with a valid value, :target selects the current active # element, ::selection selects the portion of an element that is selected by a user.

questions.statement: background-blend-mode is not supported by?
questions.explanation: background-blend-mode is not supported by Internet Explorer, background-clip, background-color, background-image, background-origin, background-position, background, background-repeat, background-size are supported by all the browsers.

questions.statement: @font-feature-values are only supported in _______________
questions.explanation: @font-feature-values are supported by Firefox only, font-kerning is supported by all the browsers, font-language-override is supported by firefox only, font-varient is supported by all the browsers.

questions.statement: A grid is not supported by _______________
questions.explanation: Grid is not supported by Internet Explorer, grid-area, grid-auto-column, grid-column, grid-column-start, grid-column-end, grid-auto-row, grid-row-gap, grid-row-start is supported by all the browsers.

questions.statement: outline-offset is not supported by _______________
questions.explanation: outline-offset is not supported by Internet Explorer, outline, outline-color, outline-style, outline-width are supported by all the browsers.

questions.statement: @page is not supported by _________________
questions.explanation: @page is not supported by chrome, page-break-after, page-break-before, page-break-inside, perspective, perspective-origin, pointer-events, position are all supported by all the browsers.

questions.statement: Which of the following is set for horizontal offset of the shadow?
questions.explanation: h-offset is the required value, it is for the horizontal offset of the shadow. A positive value puts the shadow on the right side of the box, a negative value puts the shadow on the left side of the box.

questions.statement: Which of the following is used for spread radius?
questions.explanation: blur is an optional value, it sets the spread radius. A positive value increases the size of the shadow, a negative value decreases the size of the shadow. For blur radius we set the value blur, the higher the number, the more blurred the shadow will be spread.

questions.statement: What changes the shadow from an outer shadow?
questions.explanation: inset is an optional value, it changes the shadow from an outer shadow (outset) to an inner shadow, initial sets this property to its default value, inherit inherits this property from its parent element.

questions.statement: What scales the background image as large as possible?
questions.explanation: The contain keyword scales the background image to be as large as possible but both its width and its height must fit inside the content area. As such depending on the proportions of the background image and background positioning area, there may be some areas of background which are not covered by the background image.

questions.statement: Which property specifies where the background image is positioned?
questions.explanation: The CSS background-origin property specifies where the background image is positioned. This property takes three different values namely border-box, padding-box, content-box. In content-box the background images start from the upper left corner of the content.

questions.statement: Which property specifies the painting area of the background?
questions.explanation: The CSS background-clip property specifies the painting area of the background, the property takes three different values, border-box-, padding-box, content-box. In content-box the background is painted within the content box.

questions.statement: Which of the following will show a pop-up window that breaks into pieces once clicked?
questions.explanation: A pop-up window that breaks into pieces once clicked is called click and break it, in 3D movement effect a 3D message made with CSS3 and jQuery that follows user’s mouse movements will be shown.

questions.statement: Which of the following comes with a smooth full screen overlay effect?
questions.explanation: Overlay pop-up comes with a smooth full screen overlay effect, conformation pop-up comes with a full screen overlay effect and nice transition animation, welcome pop-up is a pop-up with nice animation effect.

questions.statement: Which of the following will display a speech bubble pop-up?
questions.explanation: cartoon pop-up shows a speech bubble pop-up that fades in once hovered in the circle, a pop-up question form that smoothly appears once clicked a button, in modal animation physics a transition animation inspired by the menu pop-ups in Super Mario 3D.

questions.statement: Which of the following will give a minimalist entrance effect on hover?
questions.explanation: A minimalist yet charming entrance effect on hover is shown by linear pop-up, a distinguishable pop-up with beautiful entrance effect and “flappy” buttons are shown by “flappy” buttons, a material design comes with a fade-in animation in material design style.

questions.statement: What should be added to create a horizontal menu?
questions.explanation: For creating a horizontal menu, we add pure-menu-horizontal class name, we can mark a selected list element by adding pure-menu-selected class to the list element, to create a scrollable horizontal menu, we add pure-menu-scrollable class name.

questions.statement: Which of the following name should be added to mark a link as disabled?
questions.explanation: To mark a link as disabled we add an <a> element with pure-menu-disabled class name, responsive vertical menu collapses behind a hamburger, responsive horizontal-to-vertical-menu, slides out of view.

questions.statement: Which of the following does not support the “:hover” pseudoclass?
questions.explanation: IE 6 does not support the “:hover” pseudoclass on elements other than anchor tags. To get hover work in IE6, we create a class that duplicates the :hover styles, and then script a function to toggle that class on/off.

questions.statement: Which class is used for setting perspective and scroll properties for the page?
questions.explanation: .wrapper sets the perspective and scroll properties for the whole page, .section is for size, display and text properties, mostly not relevant to parallax effect, .static add a background to a section, just for demonstration.

questions.statement: Which of the following is used for adding perspective background images for each section?
questions.explanation: .bg1, .bg2 adds the respective background images for each section, we can use img tag also, .parallax adds an ::after pseudo-element with the background image and transforms needed for the parallax effect.

questions.statement: Which of the following position is based on the user’s scroll position?
questions.explanation: An element with position: sticky, is positioned on the user’s scroll position. A sticky element toggles between relative and fixed, depending on scroll position, It is positioned relative until a given offset position is met in the viewport, then it “sticks” in place.

questions.statement: Which of the following does not support sticky version?
questions.explanation: Internet explorer, Edge 15 and earlier versions do not support sticky positioning. Safari requires a –webkit-prefix. W should also specify at least one of the top, right, bottom or left for sticky positioning to work.

questions.statement: What sets the stack order of an element?
questions.explanation:
The z-index property specifies the stack order of an element i.e. which element should be placed in front of, or behind, the others, an element can have positive or negative stack order,
 img {position: absolute; left: 10px; top: 10px; z-index: -1;}

questions.statement: What clips an absolutely positioned elements?
questions.explanation: clip clips an absolutely positioned element, bottom sets the bottom margin edge for a positioned box, position specifies the type of positioning for an element, right sets the right margin edge for a positioned box.

questions.statement: Which of the following is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor?
questions.explanation: An element with position: absolute; is positioned relative to the nearest positioned ancestor, instead of position relative to the viewport like fixed. However, if an absolute positioned element has no positioned ancestors, it uses the document body and moves along with page scrolling.

questions.statement: Which of the following position element is not affected by the top, bottom, left etc. property?
questions.explanation: HTML elements are positioned static by default, static positioned elements are not affected by top, bottom, left and right properties. An element with position: static; is not positioned in any social way, it is always positioned according to the normal flow of the page.

questions.statement: What is the default value of object-fit?
questions.explanation: Object-fit has can be set with five values. When set to the value fill, it is the default value which stretches the image to fit the content box, regardless of its aspect-ratio, contain increases or decreases the size of the image to fill the box whilst preserving its aspect-ratio.

questions.statement: Which value will compare the difference between none and contain?
questions.explanation: When setting the value to scale-down the image will compare the difference between none and contain in order to find the smallest concrete object size when set to cover the image will fill the height and width of its box.

questions.statement: object-fit is not supported by _______
questions.explanation: In the desktop, object-fit is not supported by Internet Explorer but supported by chrome, opera, firefox, edge, safari. In mobiles or tablets iOS Safari, Opera Mobile, Opera Mini, Android, Android Chrome, Android Firefox support this.

questions.statement: Which of the following is a library for JavaScript?
questions.explanation: PlotKit is a library for JavaScript that is an improved version of CanvasGraph. It lets us build various sorts of charts and graphs without a hitch. In list bar chart we style definition list and convert it into a timeline chart.

questions.statement: Which of the following will not use JavaScript?
questions.explanation: Pure CSS3 experimental charts do not use any JavaScript & zero image, but can be viewed in Webkit browsers. Animated Stacked Bar Graph use D3 chart and JavaScript, it is developed to mimic live data feed, and give an illusion of how to handle data on the backend.

questions.statement: Which of the following uses AngulaJS?
questions.explanation: 3D prisma are created with HTML and CSS3(D) transforms, shaded with CSS gradients, animated with CSS transitions. AngularJS is used to write up an updating dataset. The size and thickness of the animated donut chart can be easily edited via CSS, JavaScript will do the rest.

questions.statement: Which of the following moves an element from its current position?
questions.explanation:
The translate() method moves an element from its current position according to parameters given for X-axis and Y-axis,
 div {-ms-transform: translate(12px, 100px); -webkit-transform: translate(12px, 100px); translate(12px, 100px);}

questions.statement: Which of the following will rotate an element clockwise or counter-clockwise?
questions.explanation:
The rotate() method rotates an element clockwise or counter-clockwise according to the given degree,
 div {-ms-transform: rotate(12deg); /*IE*/ -webkit-transform: rotate(12deg); transform: rotate(12deg); }

questions.statement: Which of the following increases or decreases the size of element?
questions.explanation:
The scale() method increases or decreases the size of an element according to the parameters given for width and height,
 div {-ms-transform: scale(3,5); -webkit-transform: scale(3,5); transform: scale(3,5);}

questions.statement: What skews an element along X and Y-axis?
questions.explanation:
The skew() method skews an element along X and Y-axis by the given angles,
 div {-ms-transform: skew(10deg, 20deg); -webkit-transform: skew(10deg,20deg); transform: skew(10deg,20deg);}

questions.statement: What combines all the 2D transform methods into one?
questions.explanation: The matrix() method combines all 2D transform methods into one, the matrix() method takes six parameters, containing mathematic functions, that allows us to rotate, scale, move or skew the elements.

questions.statement: What does not affect the element itself?
questions.explanation: perspective() does not affect the element itself, but affects the transforms of descendant element’s 3D transform, allowing them all to have a consistent depth perspective.

questions.statement: Which value specifies a transition effect with a slow start, then fast, then end slowly?
questions.explanation: The transition-timing-function property takes the value ease. It specifies a transition effect with a slow start, then fast, then end slowly and this is the default value, ease-in specifies a transition effect with a slow start.

questions.statement: Which of the following specifies a transition effect with same speed from start to end?
questions.explanation: linear value specifies a transition effect with the same speed from start to end, ease-in-out specifies a transition effect with a slow start and end, ease-out specifies a transition with a slow end.

questions.statement: Which of the following specifies how many seconds a transition effect takes to complete?
questions.explanation: transition-duration specifies how many seconds or milliseconds a transition effect takes to complete, a transition is a shorthand property for setting the four transition properties into a single property.

questions.statement: What specifies the speed curve of transition effect?
questions.explanation: transition-timing-function specifies the speed curve of transition effect, transition-property specifies the name of the CSS property the transition effect is for, transition-delay specifies a delay in seconds for transition effect.

questions.statement: Which of the following defines a MIME string format of the content being returned?
questions.explanation: Content-type:string is a MIME string defining the format of the content being returned, example is content-type:text/html, last-modified: string defines the date of last modification of the file.

questions.statement: What defines the date when information becomes invalid?
questions.explanation: expires: sate string defines the date when information becomes invalid. This should be used by the browser to decide when a page needs to be refreshed. A valid date string should be in the format 01 Jan 1998 12:00:00 GMT.

questions.statement: Which of the following specifies the length of the data being returned?
questions.explanation: content-length: string specifies the length in bytes of the data being returned. The browser uses this value to report the estimated download time for a file. Set-cookie: string set the cookie passed through the string.

questions.statement: Which variable defines the data type of the content?
questions.explanation: The data type of the content is defined by content_type variable, used when the client is sending attached content to the server, like file upload etc, the length of the query information is defined by content_length, it’s available only for POST requests.

questions.statement: What returns the set cookies in the form of a key?
questions.explanation: http_cookie returns the set cookies in the form of key and value pair, in http_user_agent user-agent request-header field contains information about user agent originating the request. It’s the name of the web browser.

questions.statement: Which of the following gives the path for CGI script?
questions.explanation: path_info provides the path for the CGI script, query_string gives URL-encoded information that is sent with GET method request, remote_addr gives the IP address of the remote host making the request.

questions.statement: What gives the full path to CGI script?
questions.explanation: script_filename gives the full path to the CGI script, script_name gives the name of the CGI script, server_name gives the server’s hostname or IP address, request_method is the method used to make the request, the most common methods are GET and POST.

questions.statement: Which of the following is not a combinatory?
questions.explanation: Combinator explains the relationship between the selectors. There are four combinators in CSS, child selector (>), adjacent sibling selector(+), general sibling selector(~), descendent selector (space).

questions.statement: Which of the following selects all elements that are siblings of the specified element?
questions.explanation: General sibling selector selects all elements that are siblings of a specified element, adjacent sibling selector selects all elements that are adjacent siblings of the specified element, child selector selects all elements that are immediate children of the specified element.

questions.statement: Which of the following adds the value of a counter to an element?
questions.explanation: counter() or counters() function adds value of counter to an element, content inserts generated content, counter-increment increments a counter value, counter-reset creates or resets a counter.

questions.statement: Which of the following specifies how to slice border image?
questions.explanation: border-image-slice specifies how to slice border image, border-image-outset specifies the amount by which border image area extends beyond the border box, border-image is a shorthand property for setting all the border-image properties.

questions.statement: Which web font was developed by Apple and Microsoft in the late 1980s?
questions.explanation: TrueType (TTF) is a font standard developed in the late 1980s by Microsoft and Apple. It is the most common font format for both Microsoft Windows and Mac OS operating systems.

questions.statement: Which of the following is a format for scalable computer fonts?
questions.explanation: OpenType (OTF) is a format scalable for computer fonts, it was built on TrueType, and is a registered trademark of Microsoft. These fonts are used commonly today on major computer platforms.

questions.statement: Which font format is used in web pages?
questions.explanation: WOFF is font format used in web pages. It was developed in 2009. It is essentially OpenType or TrueType with compression and additional metadata. The goal is to support font distribution from the server to client over the network with bandwidth constraints.

questions.statement: What value lets animation to play forwards first then backward?
questions.explanation: When the value is set to alternate the animation is played forwards first then backward. When a value is set to alternate-reverse, the animation is played backward first, then forwards. At normal value the animation is played as normal, this is the default value.

questions.statement: Which value specifies animation with slow start?
questions.explanation: ease-in specifies an animation with a slow start, ease-out specifies an animation with a slow end, linear specifies animation with same speed from start to end, ease specifies an animation with a slow start, then fast, then end slowly.

questions.statement: How many values are there for animation-full-mode property?
questions.explanation: animation-fill-mode property specifies the style for the target element when an animation is not playing. There are four values for this property namely none, forwards, backwards, and both. None is the default value.

questions.statement: Which of the following specifies animation code?
questions.explanation: Akeyframes specifies animation code, animation is shorthand property which sets all the animation property, animation-delay specifies the delay for start of the animation, animation-delay specifies a delay for start of the animation.

questions.statement: Which specifies the speed curve of animation?
questions.explanation: animation-timing-function specifies the speed curve of animation, animation-play-state specifies whether the animation is running or paused, animation-name specifies the name of @keyframes animation.

questions.statement: How many values are there for the object-fit property?
questions.explanation: object-fit property can have 5 properties names fill, contain, cover, none, scale-down. The default value is fill, the replaced content is sized to fill element’s content box, with help of contain the replaced content is scaled to maintain its aspect ratio while fitting element’s content box.

questions.statement: Which property specifies the number of columns an element should be divided into?
questions.explanation: column-count specifies the number of columns an element should be divided into, column-fill specifies how to fill the columns, column-gap specifies the gap between columns, column-rule is for setting all the column-rule properties.

questions.statement: Which property is used for setting column-width and column-count?
questions.explanation: columns is a shorthand property for setting column-width and column-count, column-width specifies suggested, optimal width for columns, column-span specifies how many columns an element should span across.
